I'll start with the negatives:The wings have become less spicy and more dry over time.It's always crowded with yuppies/blaring music on weekend nights.The morning/afternoon waitress with the hipster glasses is TERRIBLE.the new tables/booths are uncomfortable and .Aside from those minor things, this place is fantastic.  I've been going here for over 5 years now and aside from a price increase (and the wings) it's been the same since: super strong tasty margaritas, good mexican food and attentive, friendly staff.The brunch menu is yummy; there's the usual fare, pancakes, french toast and mexican tinged breakfasts as well. Be sure to get the potatoes. So good.They've got about 15 flavors of margaritas and they come in huge milkshake glasses which are worth the price. I reccomend the melon, strawberry and raspberry margs. I haven't noticed if it's still up but there used to be a sign saying they would only serve you 3 in one sitting and though i've never had a problem getting more, 2-3 is really all you need to get a good buzz/drunk going.Be sure to try the Fat Mexican (a sampler platter including wings, broccoli poppers, quesadillas, and flautas for $15) and get a seat outside for prime people watching. I make it a point to go at least once a month and unless something drastic happens (like switching to margarita glasses or new management) I don't forsee ever changing that ritual.

I was there on the 4th of July with a friend. We ordered drinks and food. While we were eating a MID-SIZE ROACH, yes you read right, a ROACH, decided to crawl on our table! My friend and I got up and told the waiter. And this is why I'm writing this review, when I told the waiter he basically shrub it as it is NOT news to him! He could have played it off and act surprise but he didn't. Sooooo, this is the last time I'll eat there. Good luck!!

This deserves a 3.5 stars.  Margaritas were AWESOME!!!  I had the Mango and the Sangria margaritas.  Definitely try the Sangria margarita.  I had two and I had a wonderful little buzz.  Went to Hoboken Pet afterwards and spent too much money on things that my cats don't need.I thought the food was good, but wasn't anything too memorable.  My boyfriend wasn't crazy about his dish (I can't remember what it was, but it had beef in it).  I had the shrimp fajitas.  Tons of shrimp and the peppers and onions were pretty tasty.  I didn't really like the interior of the restaurant, but the margaritas made me feel good, so I'll let that slide.  I sort of want to give it 4 stars, but read a review about a pest problem, and that grosses me out.

First time there tonight!  Margaritas were awesome.  Out of a machine but I understand why you can only have 3!  On to the food... My usual Mexican spots are in Union City and North Bergen; Puerto Vallarta, El Rey del Taco and Taqueria Veracruz.  I ventured outside my comfort zone.  If you are looking for authentic Mexican food, this isnt the place.  The food isn't terrible but you can find better and cheaper if you go up the hill.

Good drinks and fair prices... However, to not be able to "guarantee" a table because it's a Friday night and the booths are occupied is ridiculous. A smarter way of doing business would be to ask the people not eating and only drinking in the booths to get up. The reason being that more revenue would be generated if they sold more food, hence having the booths in the first place. Guess more business and paying customers are not needed in this establishment. So I will never go again.

First time I went here the waitress forgot to give our order to the kitchen. We had to wait 2 hours for food but got two free pitchers of sangria. Frustrating, but I'll forgive mistakes especially when there are free drinks involved.This time, we got our food right away only mine had pieces of broken glass in it. We got a free meal and drinks, but no amount of free anything will make me return to a place where I nearly cracked a molar and swallowed pieces of glass. Sorry, East LA, but that's unforgivable.
ONLY PLACE TO SEE PAY PER VIEW FIGHTS IN HOBOKEN!!!!Drinks....idkFood.....idkWent there to see Mosley get pounded by Pacman it was awsome. $10 cover fee.

I hate to do this because I used to really like East LA but it's pretty clear that cleanliness has taken a back seat. inside is filthy! Saw a little MOUSE in the DINING  room halfway through my meal. If they're in the dining room, I can not imagine what the kitchen or food storage areas are lol. The manager (nice guy) definitely knew all about the mice and told me they've been having exterminators come every week or so and comped our entire bill .I will never go back.

Being a native Texan, I'm seriously on a mission to find the best mexican food joint in the tri-state area. Slowly, but surely, it will be done.Okay, my review. Well, we (my native new yorker boyfriend and me) started with chips with salsa and guac. Chips were stale (waa-waa-waa), but guac and salsa were fine (yay). I bought the 'mexican tacos' - half chicken, half steak. They weren't bad actually. I'm pretty picky about beans and rice (only like my grandma's and my dad's), but the corn on the rice was a cool twist. The margaritas were yummy, as the reviews stated. I was a little apprehensive before tasting mine because I saw a margarita machine. Usually the margaritas from those things never seem strong enough. But they were definitely strong. It was quite a cold day, so my frozen marg. took awhile to drink (brain freeze). Our ticket for my taco plate, his fajitas, and 4 margaritas was $60. Not the cheap i thought i heard about, but I would consider going again, maybe just for the drinks though.

Went to East LA for lunch the other day and it was okay. I'd say the margaritas were 5-star, the food was 4-star (with the exception of the guac, which was 1-star) and the service was a 2-star. Overall a solid meal, but nothing amazing.The chips and salsa that they give you when you sit down are really, really good. But the food kind of went downhill from there. The guac was awful. Very little flavor and the avocado wasn't ripe. Avoid at all costs.The rest of the food was okay Mexican food, but I think I would go back at some point. Definitely going to get more margaritas next time.

Definitely home to some of the strongest margaritas in Hoboken. With that said, there is basically not much else you should bother ordering at this place. After trying a variety of their menu: nachoes (with chili, with chicken, with meat), enchiladas and flautas. I've come to the conclusion that they have no idea what Mexican food is supposed to taste like. The best (and safest) thing to order is their tortilla basket (skip the refried beans). That way you can actually eat most of what it brings and have some fresh pico de gallo. It's also a bit pricey for the quantity and quality that you're getting. Not to completely kill off this place (because I actually really love their margaritas), their service sucks. They take way too long to see if you need another drink or your bill. I would suggest coming here in the summer, that way you can sit outside with a curacao margarita (and a side shot of patron) and watch the rest of the alcoholics parade around Hoboken.

Came here with a couple of girlfriends a few weeks ago and our experience was disappointing. Food was just OK and tasted greasy, none of us wanted the leftovers. My out of town friends described it as "cheap Mexican" If I wanted cheap Mexican in Hoboken I would go to the Taco Truck but there a few much better Mexican places in Hoboken to go to. The place also had a bit of a sketchy crowd and could definitely use a good scrub down (especially in the bathroom)! I live around the corner and would not return here unless it was for a drink special and  I could sit outside.

The food is pretty standard. However, both times I've been here now they BLARE club music. It makes for an awful dining experience. I couldn't even hear the people across the table! I will be going elsewhere next time.

Tuesday buy one entree get one free!, theres a catch, theres a one time service fee which is more than some of the entrees. i love this place but this scam got me once and left the worse flavor in my mouth.. im one unhappy customer
Never been disappointed by their chicken flautas! The chips and salsa, best around!

Taco salad is a must and the dressing is amazing. Place is awesome but looses some points due to the service. First time was great. The second when it was not even that busy, the server didn't seem to care much and came around a few times and when he finally came around he took our plates and dropped a check without asking if we were even done or wanted anything else meanwhile he left us there to take care of some drunk girl sitting in the stairs smoking a cigarette. Food was great ... Service not so much.
The Fajitas are really good, as are the chips/salsa.  The service is usually pretty inattentive though.  Never anything specifically bad, they just don't pay you much attention.

How this place has fallen off so much in a couple of years is beyond me. I think I remember hearing they went under new management a couple of years back. Back when I was still at school in Hoboken, this was a pretty good happy hour place to visit. $5 frozen margaritas and free chips = quality. But ever since then, they've gotten rid of the happy hour specials, raised the prices on everything, and made the food really really crappy.The only time to even venture in here for food is Tues nights (2 for 1 entrees). Alas, what they give you in quantity, they take away in quality; borderline terrible food, and barely worth it at the discounted price (definitely not worth it at the regular price). I haven't walked by recently, but I think they might have even gotten rid of this special.As a night spot, it's also really not worth it. They have 1 small bar area in the front, and (for whatever reason) people pack in here like lemmings (for a similar situation, see Green Rock). They claim to have a late night happy hour special ($5.25 frozen margaritas). I've been a few times late night and they did not honor this price; other times, they did. The waitresses and bartenders are nice enough.. which is the only reason I didn't give this place a 1. if you want better Mexican food, go to Charrito's a few blocks away. If you want a good nightlife scene... go anywhere else in Hoboken really.

I used to really like East La for two reasons: they made pretty decent food and they were cheap (especially compared to so many other Hoboken places). However, I went back tonight and it seems since the last time I went, they changed their menu and raised their prices. Sorry East La, you were good before because we didn't expect perfect Mexican food because the price was right and our bellies were full. Now you shortened your menu, raised your prices and sadly, I now see that ya ain't nothin' too special. I'll be moving on-- it's time you reevaluate.

I've been here many times over the years and I'm always happy to come back.The margaritas taste great and as far as potency goes... well,  "One margarita, two margarita, three margarita, floor" definitely holds up here.I always enjoy my Suburban Quesadilla or the Camerones Sotovento and the service is always great.

I can't say I would recommend this place to a friend. The staff was downright rude. On multiple occasions, they yelled towards friends in the street. Our waitress was also slightly too intrusive. The food was only decent and certainly not good enough to compensate for the ambience. Save some time, go to Qdoba.

This review is definitely for kick-ass margaritas. And I mean KICK ASS. One drink and you are nice, two and you are really nice, three...don't get up. I see so many bad reviews about this place...yes the wait staff is slow, yes the the margarita glasses are really for milkshakes, and yes it might seem dark and perhaps not so clean (of course I have never noticed the latter since it is pretty dark) , but the food isn't all that bad, it helps me stand up after drinking. But I think if you want a good time, eat some chips and salsa and get totally plastered on margaritas, this is the place for you.
Great drinks, lousy food, have a few frozen margeritas and the lousy food tastes ok.

Cheap food and strong drinks draw an excited crowd, one that probably doesn't even care or remember what the food tastes like after 2-3 margaritas. Chips and salsa were okay. Guacamole was okay. Everything else? I almost feel bad for being this harsh because my waitress was so sweet, but I'm just going to say it: If I ate Taco Bell and then regurgitated it on my plate, it would have tasted better.

Decent price for decent food with large portions.On Mondays they've got half-price appetizers and $5 margaritas. This makes for a pretty cheap meal. As for margaritas, you can make some fun and exciting (or terrifying) flavors by mixing their options, just ask Julia!Not the best Mexican food in Hoboken, but it's not too bad. Stay away from the buffalo wings, these aren't their specialty. I made that mistake once. Never again...never again!

I've come here many times. I don't think it's great by any means but it's just convenient & I like to drink margaritas outside! (Who doesn't?)Yesterday my friends & I arrived around 7pm to grab some drinks & apps outside. I had my 12 pound dog with me, he goes to dinner with me all over Hoboken, so nothing new. The hostess sat us, she gushed over my dog, the waiter greeted him...Everything was fine. My dog stayed under my seat the entire meal. Over an hour after we were there, some waiter from inside randomly came running out to tell me my dog had to be OUTSIDE the fence. I had been there for over an hour at that point, I was seated not around anyone else, and my dog was just laying down on the pavement not doing anything. I found this announcement, which was very loud, to be completely uncalled for and rude. Even if my dog had to be outside the fence, there is a way to say it...and that was not to run at my, yell at me, and walk away so that everyone around me heard.Got my check & left. Will not be coming back anytime soon. I refuse to be a patron to a place that staffs rude ignorant people. Business pays your salary dude! Be nice.

East LA should just cancel out their restaurant portion and just keep it as a bar. Seriously, their food is just awful...the drinks are okay the best thing they've got going is their margaritas but even those leave you with a stomach ache after a few hours..

This place was the WORST! The music was so loud it felt like a club! Our table was crooked, the food was awful, it looked like the place hadn't been properly cleaned in YEARS! The hostess looked like she lost her stripper pole. I won't EVER return here. The food was barely considered MEXICAN.

I've been coming to East LA since its inception and it used to be a favorite place, especially for Margaritas and breakfasts. No more. After living out of state for more than a decade, I returned to find a place where the food isn't as good, the prices are higher, and most of all THE SERVICE SUCKS. You want to talk about SLOW. There was no reason for that, either, as the couple times I've come there have been almost no customers. East LA, you have competition in town, I don't see why you aren't stepping it up, not slacking off.

Horrible bartender. Came here for my bday and it was so ghetto fabulous . Bartender (Gizzelle) sucks! The bar back Leo was actually really good better than the bartender. I use to come here all the time. Never again especially on a Tuesday! Place needs to hire better bartenders . Thursday /Friday/ and Saturday are the best nights when she isn't the bartender. I recommend going on other nights .

My friend were in the mood for Mexican so we ended up here. I ordered the Enchiladas and I ate all of it. I don't eat Mexican food often and that was only second time I've ever eaten Enchiladas in my life. Compared to Cheesecake factory, East LA's were better. But I'm certain better tasting one's are offered elsewhere. It was an okay experience (compared to my friends who were quite dissatisfied) but I probably won't come back here.P.S. I think it was a little dirty in there... sadly the lights were so dim that I couldn't tell. ....maybe that's why the lights were so dim?
Love ordering the frozen margaritas and chips.  I stick with my favorites like the school yard and various burritos.

I wish I could give this 3.5 stars. Everything was good-- nothing was spectacular. Do you know what I mean? Service was good, food was decent (I had the shrimp fajitas. Shrimp were large and fresh but the rest was a little too oily for my liking). We went on Tuesdays and they do buy one get one entrees. If it weren't for that, I would probably say this place was a little too expensive for what it was but, uh.... yeah.

HORRIBLE!It's like a college campus pub that serves crappy Mexican food.  Loud, obnoxious club and rap music, bad lighting, dark-n-dank-n-dirty, snook-alike waitress who, of course, screwed up our order.  Margaritas suck.  This place is great for young people who have no experience eating authentic Mexican food or those who have an underdeveloped palate.Spend your money elsewhere.  I should have listened to Yelp!
Food was tasty and margarita was great. Not the best Mexican food ever but it was pretty delicious.  I recommend it. The staff was nice.

Let me start off by saying that the only reason why I gave this establishment 2 stars is because the manager was kind after 2 entrees were returned for looking like slop served from a frozen box, and the happy hour of margaritas with cheap tequila will get you drunk enough not to care that your food SUCKS!  I would recommend this place only to someone that I would enjoy watching suffer about 2 hours of restaurant torture. Between the hour it took half of our table to get their food, to the weird techno music they blasted (I was waiting for someone to ask me if I wanted glow sticks and a hit of ecstasy), I would soon rather eat refried beans out of a can from 1985 before I went back. Cheers to the manager and Matt, they were great. Other than that... NO WAY!

Over the years, this restaurant has slowly gone downhill.  I actually used to really like this restaurant (roasted vege burritos are the bomb) and have been here many times, but my last visit there prompted me to write this review.  THE SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE.  Our waitress was a young woman, who had poor manners, rude, unprofessional conduct, and just overall was not service-oriented.  We had to constantly flag her down for water refills, chip and salsa refills, more silverware.  She seemed more interested in her friends that came in (family with a baby) than providing service to the customers.  She didn't even wash her hands after handling the infant mulitple times before handling our food and beverage. The prices have gone up too.  I like the food and drinks, but the service has left a bad taste in my mouth.
All I has was the margarita pitchers. 1 more and I would have had to be carried out. The piña colada one was really good. Watermelon was ok

East LA ... you've been here for so long, and yet I rarely visit.  And when I do, I learn why I don't come here (sans the first time where you were decent).Hmm ... the high points of my time here.  Hanging out with my friends ... hanging out with my friends ... can I come back to this later?Everything else: Service went from good to meh to really meh.  He dropped off food, and almost ceased to exist until check time.  Food was not very good at all or at least my meal wasn't.  Steak was extremely grizzly, tasted like shoe leather, missing whatever sauce that was supposed to be with it, mediocre rice, and the plate contained an abundance of beans, which I asked not to include at all.  It must have been opposite day.Back to the high points: The chips were decent.  My friend's meals looked decent.Tonight, I was not impressed at all.  I hope it's not always like this, because if it is, I wonder how they're still here, and a place like Flacoz Tacoz (which tasted really good in my opinion), goes out of business.

We went there last night for Jason's bday after I had read reviews on yelp. This place is great!! Everyone was super nice, the food was yummy- they give you big portions of chips and salsa & the margarita's were AMAZING!! AND they had banana flavor!! They were a little higher than I thought they should be for Hoboken, but well worth it. The table next to us started talking to us and bought Jason a drink for his bday- so sweet. Then right as we were leaving, Daphne Oz from The Chew on ABC walked in with her family & was seated right behind us. She was so nice and gracious enough to pose for a picture! We will definitely be going back!!

We go here most Fridays for our date night.  The food is good and reasonably priced, but the frozen margaritas are ridiculous.  The raspberry one tastes like there is no alcohol in it, but it must be pretty strong because one small pitcher is all we need for the night.  Now that the weather is getting better this is also a good place to sit outside.

I finallllllllly went to this place last night.....egh! The waitress took forever to bring our food and never brought my second drink (BTW-I didnt even notice if they charged me for it). I ordered the guacamole appetizer dip and it was bland, needed salt or lime juice--something. Anyhow- was very dissapointed. :(

I think of good mexican food and margaritas that will put you on your ass and this place comes to mind.  The food has good portions for a moderate price.  The salsa is flavorful and free with chips served while you're ordering.  TRY THE MARGARITAS!  Strong as hell, but taste great and they have like 10 different flavors.  Get the pitcher you'll save some cash.  The problem is the place can get PACKED with college people and drunken yuppies and you can easily wait for 1 hr for a table plus they close earlier than expected on a weekend. The music is completely random from The Cure to whatever top 40 crap is out there.  I go here for great food, loud music and brain freeze that gets you drunk..

Food here is OK at best, they do have a great $5 Margarita Monday special, they have pre-made frozen margaritas, dont let the pre-made fool you, they are very strong. I would not recomend going here for the food but a great place for drinks.
I really enjoyed the fajitas. Though the service was somewhat slow and inattentive..It's always packed, the atmosphere fun and lively.  A good place to go for happy hour!

Even though it isn't the best Mexican around, the place is ALWAYS crowded!  Why?  It's dirt cheap.  I don't totally despise the food, I've definitely had better mexican, but for like ten bucks you can get like THREE things....tacos, burritos, enchiladas, and they aren't stingy with the portions.  You leave full, and tipsy from the margarita's and sangria.  It also has an outside seating area, which people scavenger for on nice sunshiney days, the wait staff is usually the same (owner maybe??)  every time we've been.  It's definitely an easy go-to kind of place for days that you don't feel like spending a bundle but still getting your drink on.

We went to East LA because the other restaurant we wanted to go to had a long wait. The hostess at East LA informed us that there was a 20 minute wait so we waited at the tables outside. After 30 mins, we went inside, only to find out they forgot about us. That should have been a sign to leave but we were hungry so we stayed. Big mistake.The restaurant must think that it's a bad club, starting at around 7 pm. The terrible music was so loud that we had to shout to hear eachother over the thumpa-thumpa club music circa 2002. Our frozen margaritas were poorly mixed and you could taste the tequila and strawberry syrup. They got the job done but were a bit painful to drink. Other than the decent chips and salsa, the food was bland and boring. The guacamole was a decent sized portion but did not taste fresh at all. I ordered the combo meal of a bean and cheese burrito and guacamole tostada. I had to cover my food in salsa to spice it up. The portions were big but the taste was small.  The service was awful - we had no idea who our waiter was as the one who came to our table first disappeared and throughout the night we flagged different people to accomplish the very difficult tasks of bringing and refilling our water and taking our order. When our meal was over we waited a good 20 minutes for the check. If you're looking for good Mexican, avoid East LA. I've had better food at Chipotle.

I tried several times to like East L.A. but I just can't. The food is mediocre and a glimpse into the kitchen only confirms suspicions that this place is more interested in being a bar rather than a restaurant. Every time I've eaten there it's felt like I overpaid for remarkably bland food and barely there service. There is no shortage of mexican restaurants in Hoboken that can serve fairly priced delicious food - don't bother with East LA.

Great Margaritas. Average mexican food. This place tends to draw a more mature crowd...in comparison to the type of kids that hang at Bahamama's and get pissed-drunk in this beloved city. This place is perfect to grab a few drinks in a group...definitely not a place for a first date (far from romantic). East LA keep up the good drinks and improve your dirt-looking refried beans, thank you.

Drinks were good, very strong, and therefore good. I wasn't a fan of the food at all or just the look of the place really. The staff tried their best but on a weekend the place is packed up front by the door by a type of zombie I can't yet categorize. Maybe I'd be back for happy hour only for drinks.

I think I like this place better than Charritos.  I know everyone loves Charritos.  I will say Charritos has much better and bigger portion of guacamole.  But I think overall I like the taste of the chips, chicken, salad and nachos better.. the margaritas are also outstanding:)  Get yourself a pitcher or two.Make sure to get some outside seating it is prime people watching.

This restaurant looks decent from the outside, but the inside is pretty outdated.  I would recommend sitting outdoors, if weather permits, because it is much nicer.  Inside it looks like a Latin-style pizzeria, with red vinyl booths and wooden tables.  The tables are all cracked and the seats are ripped.  The main reason I am even considering to give this place 3*s is because of the yummy chips and salsa that you receive on your table.  The chips are those yellow, purple, and pink tortillas, which are flavorful and with just the right amount of salt.  The salsa first looked like Minestrone soup, but actually was delicious with a fresh tomato taste and the perfect amount of seasoning.  The menu is quite large, but offers things like a diner: omelets, pancakes, burgers.  I would say only half of the menu is even Mexican.  However, all of their meals come with a rice & beans option.  I ordered two eggs scrambled, which were actually pretty good, though they looked runny.  As sides I had the choice of potatoes and toast or rice and beans.  I love rice and beans, so I tried that.  They also gave me white toast with too much butter anyway.  The rice and beans were pretty decent, though I like fresh beans rather than the refried ones, which is what they served lathered in melted cheese.  My friend had a hamburger with rice and beans, and he said it was pretty good.  The hamburger was definitely a decent size.There is also a nice sized bar offering a variety of margaritas, which had looked good.
Have been here a few times now and actually enjoy the food. Surprised by some of the reviews. Nothing fancy but great Mexican food. Margaritas are very strong but great. Great local spot in Hoboken!!

Been here a bunch of times. Amazing margaritas- sangria margarita is the best. Delicious and very strong. Food is also very good. Guacamole and shrimp quesadillas are delicious. Good atmosphere, nice staff. Gets pretty crowded on the weekends, best to call ahead.

Margaritas pack a serious punch and the food is pretty freakin good.  Huge portions and our server was helpful and in a great mood for 11 on a Wednesday night..I've walked in and out of this place about a half dozen times over the last two years since I heard it was good, but its always very very crowded and when I realize the hostess is M.I.A., I usually hit the road and go somewhere else.  I can see why it's busy, but would definitley like to see the host/hostess more attentive to people when they walk in.According to some other people's not-so humble opinion, I "must really be one of those new Hobokeners we always talk about."  I don't know who "we" is, but I'll tell you this much:  Yes, Charritos is also good, but let's be serious for a second here.  We're in New Jersey.  East LA sells enchiladas and fajitas.  If you want authentic mexican, go to Mexico.  This place is legit...assuming you can get a table.

Only good thing about this place is the margharitas ... the food sucks, if you think this is real mexican, or tex-mex or whatever, youmust really be one of those new hobokeners we always talk about. Make sure you watch out for the 6 legged friends that walk around your table, up your salt shaker and down into your salsa bowl ... i'm not kidding either. Come here and stick to chilling in the front area with a coconut margharita ... although, I must say, their thursday/friday night crowds have dwindled down since my early college days. (They must've seen the critters traveling along the place.)For some decent mexican, go up town to charro's or charritos, i forget the name, but its def. better food than here.

Yuck!Come here if you want crappy margaritas with a lot of crappy tequila, tasteless Mexican food and bad service.  They were offering their entrees for "buy one get one free" and that was over-priced.  I think that Lean Cuisine makes better enchiladas!  Not a real Mexican food experience, IMO.

I like stopping in this place on Saturday afternoons 1. Because it's a great place to cure a hang over and simultaneously work on your Sunday's best one eyed monster impression.. There is a three margarita  limit (sorry if you are a nick-cage-leaving- las vegas type of drunk...you have a problem,  start the 12 step program).2. I know the bartender and the above rule doesn't apply to me like the rest of you pee-ons.3. Chicken chimmichanga...nuff' said!

One of those local spots that seems to always be full with a divey vibe.  The margaritas were good, but definitely not as *strong* as the waitress stressed ... Then again, I just might be spoiled by my preferential treatment at my fave spot - personally mixed Margs with top-of-the-line tequila ... Kinda hard to beat!Anyhoo, the food was good - not terrific.  If you are looking to spend minimal $$ at an "okay" restaurant and leave with PLENTY of food for your next meal (or 3), East LA is your place!Your Takeaway, my friend Yelpers:+ Everyone/all waitstaff was super friendly+ The food was good / not great+ Divey vibe+ Typical Margs, nothing special (but the glasses ARE huge - that's a plus)+ Plenty of food for leftovers

The margaritas here will knock you on your behind! Even flavored, they are still super strong! They have a wide variety of flavors, though, which is cool. The taquitos are my fave. I have also tried the shrimp tacos which were ok. I'd usually just stick with the apps, chips and salsa. The noise level can get insane in here. It's a little hard to hold a convo inside. it's rather small so the wait can be severely long on a weekend. I wouldn't say it's worth waiting an hour for, but it's cool if your having a night out and can get in with no problem. There's also outdoor seating in the summer.

First time there on Sat.... It's a very small place. We waited for about 10 mins for a table. We sat towards the back in middle of two other tables, was a bit tight, but ok! They have TV's all over so that you can watch sports. The waiter was very nice. Wasn't sure what margarita to order, since I'm not much of a drinker , he gave me a pineapple with coconut margarita. My hubby ordered the Sangria Margarita which was ohh myyy... (GOOD!!). I didn't taste the liquor in my drink so the waiter took it back and said, he'll hook it up , and WOW!!  that is what he did.. I had a buzz.. LOL!! The salsa and chips are good, they will refill your chips if you ask. The food was ok!! I've had better Mexican food, but their drinks are what they are known for. Overall, its a nice place to hang out. The people are nice, the music, oh yea, was the BOMB on the night I went. It was loud, and they turned it up even louder. My hubby and I were dancing in our seats, felt like we were in a club... they needed to move the table so people can get busy and dance the night away. I didn't want to leave because the music and drinks were soooo GOOD!!!We'll be going back!! For the drinks & music of course!!!!

The food at this place is pretty decent. Not amazing, and certainly hard to compare to Mexican food from the west coast but for Hoboken its pretty good. If you're looking for Mexican food, I would go to this place over Charrito's which is probably an unlikely suggestion but I think this place is better.One aspect that I didn't particularly enjoy is that place is over the top loud. I enjoy a fun, bar atmosphere as much as the next person, but this place takes it to the next level. Get ready to have to yell if you want to have a conversation and if you're going with a group choose your seat wisely since you'll only be able to hear the people sitting directly next to you.

Amazing Salsa!  (which is never ending might I add)  As well as the hot fresh tortilla chips!  The food is good and reasonably priced.  The margaritas are delicious, they come in every flavor there!  I am a purist and like the classic margarita on the rocks, with salt but all of the margaritas I've tried have been pretty tasty.

I've been here several times for brunch and would have to say it's very hit or miss. Great service and food the first time. Lousy, inattentive service with less than satisfying food the next. Don't think I'd return or recommend it to anyone.

I give this place four stars because of the delicious margaritas, especially the frozen sangria margarita. The ambiance inside leaves a little to be desired, but I could sit outside all day sipping margaritas on a nice day.

Go, get wasted and that's really it. their drinks are good. the service poor and the food subpar. the next time i go here it won't be to eat. it'll be to get my pitcher of margarita and relax with my babe

Been here many times. Go here for the drinks only. Their margaritas will put you on your a$$. The frozen ones are my favorite. The food is not worth it unless you are really hungry or need to compose yourself after drinking the limit of three margaritas. Yes, there is a limit and good reason for it. Packed during happy hour.
Margarita's are great but the place is filthy.  There was a roach swimming in my brother's food.  It was pretty distrubing.  I won't even go there to drink anymore.  They need to clean this place up.

East LA is an obnoxious doodle on Washington Street - the work of a crude artist with little or no concept of how to create an eatery. I wouldn't leave the architect alone with a pair of scissors for fear he would stab himself to death.The interior feels dirty and has the pumping music of the nearby Bahama Mamas, except you're trying to eat a meal over the thumping tunes of generic rap artist 12 and the crew of ne'er do wells. The food itself is middling to poor Mexican food in large quantities, and the Margaritas are of the frozen variety and a classic case of 'you get what you pay for' - cheap, with bottom-shelf liquor to boot. The icing on this already putrid cake is the terrible service - the kind that you'd only expect to find from your divorced wife - which took twenty-minute-long breaks between seeing me and my girlfriend. This would be okay if there weren't two waiters to four tables and a predominantly empty bar.I gave them no tip and wrote 'work harder on your service.' Cruel? Yes. Live by the sword, die by the sword, America.

I normally like going there the food is good and the Margaritas are kick ass.. How ever when I called they aren't so friendly. I called to see if they had a Mariachi Band for Cinco de Mayo and the lady Rudely said it was to early to know. It was just a simple question a Maybe would have been sufficient. Thumbs Down for that .....

Went there on Tuesday the 20th, with 3 other friends, for an annual pre-xmas dinner out.  The main reason why we choose this place is the 2 - 1 night specials on entrees and drinks.  Service was quick and responsive, food was good, drinks flowed easily, all in all a great time.  The only thing that would have made it a 5 star review as opposed to the 4 star I am giving it, the cleanliness of the place.  Let's face it, the place is a dive.

Awesomest cheapest Mexican place to get drunk! Another great homstyle meal and an amazing drinking time!  One margarita = good. two = great. Three = gone. A great standby place for good food, a great time, and a small bill. Perfect! Outdoor seating is a must I hope you luck out!

Went here on a whim to try something new.IT was absolutely disgusting!! each and every dish was flavorless, HOW can you make flavorless tacos? I DONT KNOW.When I took a second bite, I bit into something sandy and was completely grossed out. No one at my table finished their meal.Also, the drinks are super sweet, have very little alcohol and are way expensive.

Just not excited about this place. I felt like i was sitting at a folding table in someone's garage, and it was loud but not in a fun way-- just in a noisy way.  The margaritas were good, but the food was just okay.  The service pretty awful, and even though it was cinco demayo, they weren't busy inside at all so im not sure why it took so long to get anyone's attention.I dont know why its so hard to get good mexican food in NJ but, East LA will go on my long list of last resorts for Mexican.

This is my second time here. I had the fried tiger shrimp stuffed with cheese. It was too cheesy and $8 for 4 pieces was a lil more than i expected. The nachos and salsa they serve in the beginning for free is pretty good.

This place is awesome if you love eating Mexican food while observing roaches crawl around. If roaches aren't your thing you should go for the fruit flies which will accompany you while you eat and drink your food. I will never be eating here again. The little bit of food I did eat before losing my appetite was sub-par. The margaritas were good but not enough to make up for everything else...I can't believe people have given this place more than 2 stars...
Better late than never, but they have $5 margarita specials for Monday Night Football!

Wait...what?What happened?The menu was appetizing, the salsa great...Then the worst waitress ever, combined with food that wasn't even made the way the menu stated with the ingredients the menu stated---with no explanation or help from the waitress, plus the not so great prices...=Fail.

Here is a example for any restaurateur not to follow!I was taking out a colleague on a business meeting and he said he had to try this place.  I immediately called my friend and he let me know I am in for a ride.I get there and immediately I notice the place is FILTHY!  The waitress took forever to take my drink order and some guy passing by slid it on the table.  We ordered the food after waving down the waitress (only 2 waitresses on staff!).  After 20 minutes I finish my soda and slide the cup to the end of the table.  I end up waiting another 10 minutes and someone at my table flagged down the waitress and we finally recieved a refill.  After waiting another 40 minutes and seeing people that came after us eating and leaving  - I knew there was a mixup.... The host comes by to pre-bus the table and I told him we havent eaten yet.  He says "you got to be joking with me that you havent eaten yet?"  Didnt see him after that for a while.When we ask the server she walks up to the passbar and starts up with the cooks... I tell the host can you send a manager to the table please?  He walks away and the manager never comes.  One plate out of the three comes out (1 hour after ordering).  Then finally the other two arrive.  I asked the server "what was the problem?  Did the check not print in your kitchen?  She replies with "I am sorry its not my fault - We are trying to work together"   ---- ACTUALLY it is your fault!  If you took any time out and talked to our table you wouldve found out everyone sitting there is in the restaurant industry and we all have heavy expierence in high volume restaurants unlike this craphole establishment you are working at.  We all understand the business and tried to be patient as possible but since it was so loud in there we couldnt hear each other talking the whole situation became more irritating.The food was taco bell quality - AWFUL!Chicken was stringy, corn was cold, cheese wasn't melted.  At the end of my meal I saw the host pass by and I asked him for the bill and a togo box since the waitress didnt care to ask.  The waitress came by and tells me "I took the drinks off"  Then when I look at the bill a open gratuity charge of 18% !!!!!!!!!! Unbelievable.  East LA - Learn something - SERVICE, FOOD QUALITY AND CLEANLINESS are very important in the hospitality business - East LA is poor in all aspects.Hoboken residents go down the block to Qdoba you will get better food there! At least there if you ask for a manager they will show there face once

I've been here 5+ times and cannot get over the great margaritas! They have great flavors and are pretty darn strong. The location is awesome, I love sitting in the cramped outdoor section to people-watch on Washington Street. The interior is just so-so. I've had all sorts of stuff from the menu, and prefer the appetizers to any of the entrees. The nachos are especially great. I love the fresh chips and salsa as well. It probably is not the most authentic Mexican in the area, but if you like good margaritas it is definitely worth a shot!

I'm not an expert of mexican food but I did like my food experience. It might not be authentic mex food (hoboken doesn't really have many good places to eat), but at least they did decently. I would give them another star but my experience was ruined by loud hip-hop music and dimmed lights at 7pm.. maybe its because it was a Friday night. The service was ok but I wouldn't blame them, it was such a busy night all the waitstaff were running around like headless chickens but they stil managed to crack a smile and be friendly. Maybe 3 1/2?Will definitely come back for the Margs, though.

I am not sure where the name comes from..guess LA has really progressed to a Mexican state.The food was nothing really memorable but the waitress was really nice to us and gave my table free drinks for it being my birthday. I suppose that is where the thirs star came from. Plus, I enjoyed the salsa a bit too!

OMFG!  THIS PLACE IS STILL AROUND?!I used to live at 500 Washington on the top floor...directly next to the building East L.A. occupies.  But that was back in 1991.  The food at East L.A. was crap back then, and pretty much a joke to native Hobokenites, mostly because the owner's wife was having an affair with one of the bar tenders.  All the native Hobokenites talked about it...how he was a closet homosexual...she was a virgin when she married him...it was a sexless-loveless marriage.  The gossips (men, nonetheless) were merciless.   He was my landlord, as well, and I felt bad for how mean people were behind his back, and I couldn't help but feel sorry for their little boy when he grew up.  Surely he was going to hear all this. The gossips couldn't wait to tell me, after I moved in, that I occupied the owner's mother's old apartment...which she "earned" by having an affair with the mayor.  Apparently, she did pretty well as his mistress because he put the building in her name, as well as a few others, like the one East L.A. occupies on the ground floor.  I'm glad I didn't grow up in such a small town with petty people who couldn't wait to see me fail.  It is shocking sometimes how unbelieveably cruel and callous people can be.  Anyway, small town drama aside, it was the food that was a joke to me.  I was raised on Mexican food as a child, and this food didn't resemble anything close to Mexican food, aside from the names on the menu.  It was horribly disappointing.  The salsa tasted like marinara and the rice and beans...yuk!  I have a suggestion for the manager...HIRE A MEXICAN COOK OR TWO...not someone from Puerto Rico or Santo Domingo.  And your grandmother's marinara recipe does NOT work for salsa...try some clinatro...lime... tomatillos...or just skip the food altogether and focus solely on what you're really there to sell...alcohol.

The food here is just your average Tex-Mex, nothing special.  However the margaritas are pretty decent (especially for the $5 happy hour price).  The wait staff was friendly and helpful.I would come here again for drinks , but not for dinner.  I think if you're better off at Charrittos if you want good Mexican in Hoboken.

Enchiladas?It was okay. Tastes not good not bad.Margarita? Okay. but I didn't tried frozen one... might be better?Waiter service?Yep,  they were friendly.However, the place was Noisy, smelly. I could see dirty garbage box and floor while i was eating their Mexican.I SERIOUSLY recommend you to have a dinner "outside".

My jersery friends are always ranting about this place so when I took a trip up there last month we went for happy hour/dinner and OMG they have the best frozen margarita's ever!!!! I am not a fan of flavored margarita's but I had their strawberry frozen one and OMG delish I loved it! The food was very good too! Def recommned this place to anyone in the area. Its a little small but great place to drink and catch up with friends. :) Oh and did I mention they have great happy hour specials if your on a budget!

This is where you get a margarita.  Anywhere.  "Oh, well, I'm from Chicago and in Chicago we go to..." No.  You do not.  You get on a plane and in about two hours, you have a terrific margarita at East LA.  "Yeah, but in NYC, we go to..."   No.  Incorrect.  In NYC, you get on the PATH train and come to Hoboken, walk up Washington, enter East LA, and get a margarita."En Mexico, vamos a ..."  No.  Vuela a Newark, toma una taxi a Hoboken, dices la conductor  "East LA, tough guy", consigues una margarita.You see where I'm going here?  Yeah, I ate here once or twice, and it was good but not great.  It beat Taco Bell, it crushed "On The Border" and Chilis.  Where it excels is in making young ladies loopy from a margarita.  These things are huge, have about two dozen varieties, and will absolutely not cost you an arm and a leg.  From what I'm told, this is a pre-club destination, where you do your warmup exercises like flirt with people and do a final pre-flight makeup check before going to whatever club you're going to start with -- in Hoboken, you're probably going to at least three clubs that night.-C

Im giving a 4 star because they do make the best margaritas around!  I usually just go here for margaritas and their chips!  Once im done, I go to the restaurant that I planned on going that night for dinner!  Always crowded, but you tend to forget about once you find a nice place to sit and drink your margaritas & eat your chips haha.

I had a rather tasty meal here this weekend.  Definitely reasonable prices but it's a little dark inside and a bit loud.  The guacamole was a high point, really yummy.  We didn't sample the drinks but my friend had to ask for a lime with his Corona-- sort of a serious infraction for a Mexican place! The staff was really nice, but service could be a little slow.  I got a chicken taco salad, and it was alright.  The chicken didn't have a great taste, but the dressing was good and the veggies were all fresh.  My friends all got a few different things, and everyone was happy with their food.  It wasn't anything groundbreaking, but it's a nice, fun place to eat in Hoboken.
Awesome magaritas! plus good food for an even better price!!

I have to give a star? I have been to this place before but my experience this time was awful. The service was slow and we had to wait forever for someone to tend to our table. Let's not talk about the roach that crawled across our table either. Maybe this place makes some good margaritas but that's where it stops. If you want better,cheaper Mexican food go down the block to Qdoba. You'll be better off.
Really good mexican food--better than most I've had on the east coast. It's just really expensive for what it is. Margaritas were good though

Food was eh unimpressive. Overpriced and not much on the plate. I expect taco shells to not come out of a box at a mexican place. Salsa tasted like it was out of a jar. I hate jar salsa. Our waiter was too busy taking shots with some drunk customer to give us our tab. Margaritas are killer! (in a good way) Just wish they didn't cost so much, when using cheap tequila in a frozen margarita, it should not cost eight dollars!
Having had my share of kick-ass Mexican food in California, this place will hold me over until my next trip home.  Tasty happy hour margaritas will always win me over.
